title: Jennifer Aniston’s ex Justin Theroux forced her to watch first film Leprechaun
text:
Jennifer Aniston became a household name thanks to her role as Rachel Green in Friends.

But her first starring role came two years before that, in a film called Leprechaun, which followed an evil leprechaun going on a killing rampage in a bid to find his pot of gold.

Yes, seriously.

And the 50-year-old revealed that her ex-husband, Justin Theroux, forced her to sit and watch the 1993 film during a date night.

Because nothing says romance like killer leprechauns…

During an appearance on the Howard Stern Show, she told the host: ‘I watched it like, 8 years ago with our mutual friend Justin Theroux for s**ts and giggles.

Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux split in 2017 (Picture: Rex)

‘We were dating. It was one of those things when I tried to get that remote out of his hand and there was just no having it.

‘He was like, “No, no, no, no, this is happening.” I just kept walking in and out, cringing.’

Everyone has to start somewhere, hun.

While it may not have been her screen debut – which came in 1988 thanks to an uncredited part in Mac And Me – Jen still felt it was a ‘big deal’.

Jen starred in Leprechaun, back in 1993 (Picture: YouTube)

‘I really thought I arrived when I did Leprechaun’ she joked. ‘It was with Warwick Davis, the guy from Willow was in it. It was a big deal!’

‘I really did think it was an amazing thing that I was in a movie,’ Aniston said.

Unfortunately for Jen, it wasn’t quite as big a deal as she thought, only racking up $8.5million (£6.9m) at the box office.

But it’s not all bad, as she went to land a role in Friends very shortly after, and the rest is history.

Jennifer is living her best single life right now (Picture: Rex)

Jennifer and Justin split back in 2017, two years after tying the knot in an intimate wedding.

And she revealed she isn’t quite ready to mingle right now and is loving being single instead.

When asked if she was enjoying the single life, she explained that she has absolutely no interest in being thrown into a blind date.

‘Hey, listen, I just don’t like being set up. I don’t like it. I hate it,’ she told the host.

And the Marley & Me actress has no time for a relationship, as she’s busy securing her bag.

‘Yeah, and I’m very busy. For now,’ she added. ‘I’m promoting [The Morning Show]. I’m prepping for next season.’

Which is fair enough.
